senses.sense_definition: The historical medical practice of inoculating a person with material from a smallpox patient in the hope of inducing immunity.

examples.text: Before the invention of the modern vaccine, <w>variolization</w> was the primary method used to protect populations from the deadly virus.
Historians note that the practice of <w>variolization</w> carried significant risks, as it involved infecting patients with the actual disease.

traits.comment: refers to an obsolete historical practice
